keyTakeAways: A North Korean submunition was discovered in a drone used to attack Ukraine in September 2024, specifically in the port city of Kherson.
The submunition was marked with Korean characters referencing the Juche calendar, indicating it was produced in Juche 89, equivalent to 2000 in the Gregorian calendar.
The submunition was originally designed for rocket artillery but was modified for use on a first-person-view drone using simple materials like wooden sticks, wire, and duct tape.
This finding establishes a direct material link between North Korea’s defense industry and the war in Ukraine.
Russia has significantly increased drone production, using cheap, large-volume drones to overwhelm Ukrainian air defenses and damage civilian morale.
North Korea has ramped up its weapons development and military modernization in recent years, including intercontinental ballistic missiles.
Approximately 12,000 North Korean troops were deployed to Russia in 2024, with around 4,000 reported killed or wounded by mid-2025.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A UK-based investigative group, Conflict Armament Research (CAR), has reported that a North Korean submunition was recovered from a drone used in an attack on the Ukrainian port city of Kherson in September 2024. The submunition, marked with Juche 89 (equivalent to 2000 CE), was originally designed for rocket artillery but was modified for use on a first-person-view drone using basic materials like wire and duct tape. This discovery establishes a direct material link between North Korea’s defense industry and the war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, Russia has intensified its drone attacks and built a massive drone production facility to overwhelm Ukrainian defenses and undermine civilian morale. North Korea has also ramped up its weapons programs and sent approximately 12,000 troops to Russia, with around 4,000 reported killed or wounded by mid-2025. The findings highlight growing North Korean military involvement in the war, raising global concerns about the proliferation of weapons from rogue states in regional conflicts.
title: North Korean submunition found in drone used to attack Ukraine, report finds
